Where can I find the standard locations for Verus wallet files on different operating systems?

The standard locations for Verus wallet files on different operating systems are:
* Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`
* Mac OS: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
* Windows 10: `%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`
Alternatively, you can find the Verus data folder through Verus Desktop by clicking `help` and then `Show Verus data folder (default)`.

# How-To: Backup my wallet?## Important General Information## Video: Watch this video with an explanation how to accomplish the steps below: [Backup your wallet](https://youtu.be/ygPsdK8Trck)### Verus `Wallet.dat`, Chaindata & `VRSC.conf` standard locations * Linux:		`~/.komodo/VRSC` * Mac OS: 	`~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC` * Windows 10: 	`%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\` * OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)`### Instruction Video External YouTube link: [Backing up the Verus Desktop wallet](https://youtu.be/ygPsdK8Trck)## Preferred method: Exporting your walletNote: The filename you replace`<mywalletexport>` with, can only contain letters and figures, no other characters, so it **cannot** have a file-extension!*#### Verus Desktop:  Go to `Settings`, `Coin Settings` and click `Export native wallet backup`.  Confirm that you want to export after reading the pop-up.  The green message will tell you where the backup is and what it's name is. #### linux/MacOS CLI:  run `./verus z_exportwallet "<mywalletexport>"` #### windows CLI:  run `verus z_exportwallet "<mywalletexport>"`Attention: Pay attention to the feedback this command gives you: it will mention the location where the export file is saved.The exported wallet should be a file called `<mywalletexport>`, standard in the same directory as your `wallet.dat`. Keep this file secure, it has your plaintext private keys. Verify that the file is there and isn't empty.## Alternate method: Backing up your walletNote: The filename you replace`<DestinationFileName>` with, can only contain letters and figures, no other characters, so it **cannot** have an file-extension#### Verus Desktop:  Go to `Settings`, `Coin Settings` and click the text box  type `run backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"` #### linux/MacOS CLI:  run `./verus backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"` #### windows CLI:  run `verus backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"`Attention: Pay attention to the feedback this command gives you: it will mention the location where the backup file is saved.The backup wallet should be a file called `<DestinationFileName>`, standard in the same directory as your `wallet.dat`. Keep this file secure, it enables full access to all your addresses. Verify that the file is present and that it is the same size as your `wallet.dat`.## Extra info for **non-Verus** chains#### Extra line in `<coin>.conf` required **Non-Verus** chains like **Komodo** and its asset chains and **Zcash**, need this entry in the coins configuration file to specify the export directory, before you started your wallet. `exportdir=<dir>`

What is the preferred method for backing up my wallet in Verus, and how do I do it?

The preferred method for backing up your wallet in Verus is by exporting your wallet. You can do this through Verus Desktop by going to `Settings`, `Coin Settings`, and clicking `Export native wallet backup`. Alternatively, you can use the command line interface (CLI) by running `./verus z_exportwallet "<mywalletexport>"` on Linux/MacOS or `verus z_exportwallet "<mywalletexport>"` on Windows. Replace `<mywalletexport>` with a filename that only contains letters and figures, without any file extension. The exported wallet file will be saved in the same directory as your `wallet.dat`.

What is the alternate method for backing up my wallet in Verus, and how do I do it?

The alternate method for backing up your wallet in Verus is by running the `backupwallet` command. You can do this through Verus Desktop by going to `Settings`, `Coin Settings`, and typing `run backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"` in the text box. Alternatively, you can use the command line interface (CLI) by running `./verus backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"` on Linux/MacOS or `verus backupwallet "<DestinationFileName>"` on Windows. Replace `<DestinationFileName>` with a filename that only contains letters and figures, without any file extension. The backup wallet file will be saved in the same directory as your `wallet.dat`.

What extra step is required for non-Verus chains like Komodo and its asset chains, as well as Zcash, before backing up my wallet?

For non-Verus chains like Komodo and its asset chains, as well as Zcash, you need to add an extra line in the coin's configuration file (`<coin>.conf`) to specify the export directory, before starting your wallet. The extra line should be `exportdir=<dir>`.
